text.__SUMMARY__: Quercus potosina is a Mesoamerican species of oak in the beech family. It is native to northern Mexico, from Chihuahua, Durango, and Jalisco east as far as San Luis Potosí.
text.Description: Quercus potosina is a shrub or small tree up to 7 meters tall, drought-deciduous. Leaves round or egg-shaped, up to 9 cm long, numerous small pointed teeth along the edges.
text.External links: photo of herbarium specimen at Missouri Botanical Garden, collected in San Luis Potosí in 1878
